DataElement.preferredName: Mutation Variation Codon Position Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/not applicable coded response regarding whether mutations in the genetic material of an organism are present in codons in specific locations.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Permanent, transmissible changes in the genetic material of an organism. Mutations can range from a single base change to the loss of a significant portion of a chromosome. These occur when DNA is not repaired prior to replication. Mutations in germ cells can be inherited. However, in somatic cells, they are not inherited. Somatic mutations can arise via exposure to chemical mutagens or ionizing radiation. These fixed changes in the genetic material can, in some cases, lead to cancer or other diseases.:An alteration or difference from a norm or standard._A specific sequence of three adjacent bases on a strand of DNA or RNA that provides genetic code information for a particular amino acid.:The particular portion of space occupied by a physical object.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Permanent, transmissible changes in the genetic material of an organism. Mutations can range from a single base change to the loss of a significant portion of a chromosome. These occur when DNA is not repaired prior to replication. Mutations in germ cells can be inherited. However, in somatic cells, they are not inherited. Somatic mutations can arise via exposure to chemical mutagens or ionizing radiation. These fixed changes in the genetic material can, in some cases, lead to cancer or other diseases.:An alteration or difference from a norm or standard.

Concepts.definition: Genetic alterations found in the neoplastic lesions of the animal model. These alterations are not made intentionally.
An alteration or difference from a norm or standard.

Property.preferredDefinition: A specific sequence of three adjacent bases on a strand of DNA or RNA that provides genetic code information for a particular amino acid.:The particular portion of space occupied by a physical object.

Concepts.definition: A specific sequence of three adjacent bases on a strand of DNA or RNA that provides genetic code information for a particular amino acid.
Position; the particular portion of space occupied by a physical object.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
